intro: Muehlenbeckia hastulata, commonly known as the narrowleaf everlasting pea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, pea-like flowers. The plant produces small, persistent, papery flowers that remain on the stems after blooming, giving it a decorative appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or sandy environments. Muehlenbeckia hastulata is also valued for its ornamental use in gardens and as a ground cover.
